alert.note: Alert for Newton (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 22 at 9:29PM EST until February 26 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Iroquois River near Foresman affecting Newton County. ...The Flood Watch is replaced with a River Flood Warning for the following rivers in Illinois...Indiana... Iroquois River at Iroquois affecting Iroquois and Newton Counties. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING TO EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Iroquois River from Near I-65 east of Foresman downstream to near US-41 north of Kentland, including the Foresman gauge. * WHEN...From Friday evening to early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, 1000 South Road threatened north of the river near Brook. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 11.4 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Friday evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. A Flood Watch means water levels above flood stage are possible, but not yet certain, based upon the latest forecasts. Persons along rivers and streams in the watch area should monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected by Thursday afternoon.
